examples: And how do you intend to redeem yourself exactly?
You can redeem the points.
The system we present to you today redeems on that pledge.
You just redeemed it.
All right, you redeemed yourself, monitor.
words.defineVi: trả hết (khoản vay hoặc kỳ phiếu)

examples: I thought the profligate had seen the light and was seeking redemption, and so I took him into my care.
- This is a redemption.
They're not beyond redemption.
There's room for redemption.
There's room for redemption.
words.defineEn: (theology) the act of delivering from sin or saving from evil
words.defineVi: (thần học) hành động giải thoát khỏi tội lỗi hoặc cứu khỏi cái ác

examples: This is atrocious.
But I have this thing where I constantly bite at my nails, the skin around my nails, and it can get to the point where it really, really hurts, it really starts to bleed, and it just looks atrocious.
Treatment of the Irish immigrants and Irish Americans during this influx of immigration was dismal at best and downright atrocious at its worst.
And it just seems atrocious to me that we would even think about that.
So Putin was fighting this war, whether it was excessive/not excessive use of force, it was an atrocious, horrific war, with horrific atrocities on both sides.
words.defineVi: đặc biệt xấu hoặc khó chịu

examples: He called this new law an atrocity.
Today, the nation's prime minister denied rebel claims of atrocities by the army.
It was an absolute atrocity.
So could one of the atrocities of war become a champion in the fight against cancer?
For the entirety of my life it's been a comical atrocity.
words.defineEn: an extremely brutal act, especially in war
words.defineVi: một hành động cực kỳ tàn bạo, đặc biệt là trong chiến tranh

words.defineEn: affecting extreme elegance in dress and manner
words.defineVi: ảnh hưởng đến sự thanh lịch cực độ trong cách ăn mặc và phong cách

examples: Maternal mortality is down.
Doom maternal opened.
But perhaps his biggest influences were his maternal grandparents.
Maternal mortality rates show that mothers, especially black mothers, risk death to give birth.
Additionally, the maternal mortality rate in the United States is more than 2 times higher than in Germany.
words.defineEn: connected to motherhood, notably during childbearing and shortly afterwards
words.defineVi: liên quan đến việc làm mẹ, đặc biệt là trong thời gian sinh con và ngay sau đó

examples: She is considered as wise as an owl and has become something of a matriarch within the community.
Wanda Kay Johnson was the matriarch of her family.
The matriarch speaks, urging the herd to leave the watering hole.
She is the beloved matriarch of a family that stretches across South America and North America.
A half hour’s march away, a rival matriarch directs her own clan to the watering hole now that she knows it’s free.
words.defineEn: a female head of a family or tribe
words.defineVi: một người đứng đầu nữ của một gia đình hoặc bộ lạc

words.defineEn: something that can serve as a source of light
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó có thể phục vụ như một nguồn ánh sáng

examples: It's actually illuminating the road.
But regardless of the fall out from Welles’ War of the World, the uncertainty in and of itself is illuminating.
Through these brilliant discoveries about light, we’ve gradually illuminated our place in the universe.
The light illuminated the droplets as bright green blips, which they captured with a cell phone camera and analyzed with a computer algorithm that counted the droplets.
When I hit the power button, the screen does still illuminate partially, but you can't do anything to it.
words.defineVi: làm sáng hơn hoặc sáng hơn

examples: It's actually illuminating the road.

words.defineVi: làm sáng hơn hoặc sáng hơn

examples: He’s egocentric.
In other words, we use egocentric terms, and view objects relative to where we are.
They are all attention seeking, gameplaying, egocentric, narcissistic, vengeful, two face, ticking time bombs ready to explode and I'm over it.
words.defineEn: thinking only about oneself, not about other people's needs or desires
words.defineVi: chỉ nghĩ về bản thân, không nghĩ về nhu cầu hay mong muốn của người khác

examples: Egoism says that everyone ought, morally, to pursue their own good.
In doing so, he echoes the doctrines of egoism and utilitarianism embraced by many of Dostoyevsky’s contemporary intellectuals.
words.defineEn: concern for your own interests and welfare
words.defineVi: quan tâm đến lợi ích và phúc lợi của riêng bạn

words.defineEn: a self-centered person with little regard for others
words.defineVi: một người tự cho mình là trung tâm và ít quan tâm đến người khác

words.defineEn: an exaggerated opinion of your own importance

một người tự phụ và tự cho mình là trung tâm

examples: Mark had always admired his boss, but after working for him for several years, he began to see his boss's weaknesses, and he started to develop a sense of contempt towards him, proving that familiarity breeds contempt.

Mark had always admired his boss, but after working for him for several years, he began to see his boss's weaknesses, and he started to develop a sense of contempt towards him, proving that familiarity breeds contempt.
"Do you have contempt for your government?"
Then the other biggest issue is his contempt for the media.
We're here for sentencing on contempt stipulation of 327.
words.defineEn: absence of respect for something or someone because one considers them unimportant and undeserving of attention
words.defineVi: thiếu sự tôn trọng đối với một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó bởi vì một người coi họ không quan trọng và không đáng chú ý
đáng bị khinh miệt hoặc khinh miệt

examples: They didn't have time to grow contemptuous of you.
words.defineEn: devoid of respect for someone or something
words.defineVi: không có sự tôn trọng cho một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó
